data.title: Latest oracle , Information & Updates
data.meta_description: ETCIO.com brings latest oracle news, views and updates from all top sources for the Indian CIO industry.
data.text:
Domestic banks lure techies from top tech companies

Domestic Indian banks, which have fast tracked their efforts to enhance their digital capabilities, are luring top-notch tech talent from leading new age companies and global firms, said senior company officials and search experts.

Microsoft India elevates key hands in top-level rejig

These announcements were formally made by the company a few weeks ago and have come into effect from July 1, the company's start of the financial year.

Oracle spending 'billions' on Nvidia chips this year: Ellison

Oracle's cloud division is working to gain ground against larger rivals such as Amazon Web Services and Microsoft Corp. To get an edge, Oracle has focused on building fast networks that can shuffle around the huge amount of data needed to create AI systems similar to ChatGPT.

Oracle adds generative AI to its human resources software

Many business users have approached generative AI technology more cautiously because it can make up untrue facts and be tricked into saying unsettling things. Oracle's human resources software is used by big businesses for hiring new employees and providing performance evaluations, among other things. Oracle will put a button on many of the fields in the software that will automatically generate draft text for things like job listings or performance goals.

Tech companies including Google gripe about unfair cloud practices

The comments, which were due Wednesday, respond to a March request from the U.S. agency for information on security issues and competition in the lucrative market for data storage and computing power in the so-called cloud.

Oracle cuts hundreds of jobs, rescinds job offers in its health unit: report

Software firm Oracle on Thursday laid off hundreds of employees, rescinded job offers and cut back open positions within its health unit, the Insider reported, citing three people familiar with the matter.

Oracle beats quarterly revenue estimates on cloud services demand

Oracle's push into the cloud computing market has started to bear fruit, helped by its acquisition of electronic medical records firm Cerner last year that has helped it better compete with industry giants like Microsoft and Amazon.com .

Airtel to provide cloud, content delivery services for government edtech platform DIKSHA

Airtel will provide end-to-end management of DIKSHAâ€™s online platforms across its mobile application and website, and will be made accessible to students for free educational content in their preferred Indian language.

Embrace better data-driven decisions, says Joey Fitts, VP of Analytics, Product Strategy, Oracle

Fitts shares some insights on how a recent global study by Oracle reveals that 90% of business leaders are in a dilemma due to a lack of qualitative data-driven decisions.
